title: Do you need a permit to replace siding? - Quora

response.answer_text: Maybe. Do it yourselfers tend to not get permits… and sometimes the regulating authority will not say anything. Siding and re-roofing are areas where this is common even if you are supposed to get a permit. But, its still best to get the permit. Many cities now want you to get a building permit for anything other than paint that costs above $250. Ask the city clerk where to go to ask about permits. (it might be the clerk) and then you ask the actual permitting office if you need a permit. The local inspector had me fill out the forms for a permit in order to do one project… came and checked a few times and gave advice and never charged the fees… because what I was doing didn’t really need a permit. Overall a nice guy who just wanted to make sure I wasn’t wasting my time and money by doing it wrong...And now he is easy to get along with when I have an idea for another project.

It depends upon your jurisdiction, but, generally, no. Most, non-structural repairs are exempt from permit requirements. Such as: Replacing a faucet or toilet doesn't require a permit.Adding a new toilet, involving new waste plumbing, will.
Not where I live. Not in most places I know. There are exceptions to that though, especially in places with homeowner associations and other bizarre bullshit. Check with your local government.
